b: ^It looks like you're on a phone or tablet.
^Depending on your device, you may not be able to hear music unless you use headphones, or turn off silent mode.

c-2: ^Scroll down as you would any web page. You can also click and drag to scroll.
^You can select choices using your mouse, the number keys, or "z", "x", and "c".
^If there's only one choice, you can use the spacebar.
^Press "q" and "e" to step forwards and backwards between passages.

g-0: ^Two years, four months, maybe a few days.
g-1: ^I didn't move here just to avoid her, but - well, it was a contributing factor.
^I didn't expect to see her here tonight.

c-0:
^I'm morbidly curious.

^I can't bring myself to run away.

^A moth drawn to a miserable flame.
c-1:
^I don't think I can summon tears.

^That's not the feeling inside me right now.

^I just feel guilty.

two.#: frame: party2_bg:5, party2_fg, party2_fg2:3, party4_fg3_shadow:-13, party4_fg3:3.5

two: ^There are enough people between me and her that I can get a bit closer without feeling obvious.
^She is standing by the window, dancing in a low-energy way.
^I have no idea what I can say to her.

s: ^"I really liked you, please talk to me."

c-0: ^ Sorry I made you scared of me."
c-1: ^ I didn't mean to scare you."
g-0: ^Perhaps I would be better off just throwing myself to the floor.
^Just chalks me up as another weirdo who wanted to fuck her.
g-1: ^He's touching her waist and saying something, and I'm just standing here thinking about whether I'm a creep.
^Maybe if I was still a guy then it would have been fine.
^You expect that kinda shit from a guy, right?
^I turn and I look at her.
^There is no face for me to tell.
^an energy despite the matte off-white bone that stares back at me, deep dark eye sockets in a pallid skull.
^Maybe my drugs have started fucking up again.

c-1: ^"I can see the shadow that follows you."
^"And you can see me too, can't you?"
c-2: ^I can feel her gaze on my shadow like two points of pressure.

c-1: ^She falters and takes a step closer.

g-2: ^"Girls like us should stick together, you know?"
^I don't want to stick together I don't want to talk I want to go home and feel sorry for myself.

s: ^"I have no idea what you mean."

g-0: ^"You pass very well for someone functional and right."
^"If you hadn't nearly started crying when looking at that girl, I wouldn't have even known."
^"I love your boots, by the way."

c-2: ^"That's the spirit. You don't have to pretend to be good."
^I struggle to think of something to respond.

g-1: ^After a moment she clears her throat.
^"Never mind. I have wine. A whole bottle, see?"
^Somehow, I get the impression of her winking.

s: ^"Why should I go anywhere with you?"

c-0: ^She sighs and looks over her shoulder.
^"This party sucks, and you look like you want to cry."
^She looks at me silently for a moment.
^Neither of us says anything for a second.
^I am suddenly, absolutely sure that she wants to cry too.

c-1: ^"It's a house party, it's there to be drunk."
^She shrugs, as if that makes it better.

b: ^"For the record, I don't condone this."
^"Then I guess I'm drinking for two."
^"I don't want to cry where everyone can see me."

seven: ^Her jaw opens slightly in a horrible impression of a grin without skin.

g-0: ^Then we're on a bench, in a quiet section of the park I didn't even know existed.
^She opens the bottle of wine with practice, chucking the cork over her shoulder, and takes a swig.
^When she hands it to me, there's somehow lipstick on the rim.

c-1: ^ She makes a little drinking motion with her hand.
g-0: ^"So what's your name, girl with two shadows?"
^I hand the bottle back to her.
^I brace for a laugh, but it doesn't come.
^She cocks her head to the side and makes a hmmm noise.
^"Bit of a mouthful to say every time, though."
^She takes a swig of wine and pulls a face.
^"No, Merry doesn't suit you. I'm going to call you Red."
g-1: ^She looks at me, some sparkle visible in her eye sockets.
^I think I'm getting used to her lack of a face.
^"Whatever you say, Red. Why were you about to cry back there?"
^I think I haven't hit her just because of the sheer affront of her questions.

b: ^ I hate that she knows that. That I'm so obvious, so easy to read.

g-1: ^"Why should I spill my guts to some random faceless girl in the park. I still don't even know your name."
^She waggles the bottle of wine at me teasingly.

s: ^She lets it go without protest, and I raise it to my lips.

g-2: ^ I don't know you, Red. And maybe you're right."
^"There's something about yourself that you can't live with. Some part you think abhorrent, to be hidden away from sight."
^"Only, hiding it inside wasn't enough. You could feel it in there still, burning away like a hot coal."
^"Some hot black little lump inside you like a smouldering heart."
^"You hated it, hated it so much that one day you wrenched that fucker free from yourself."
^"And ever since then, you've told yourself you feel better. But you don't really believe that, do you?"
^"It's not a good absence. It's not like excising a tumour, it's something more vital."
^"You cut out your heart and now it beats at the door of your soul."
g-3: ^She stops talking as I stare, dumbfounded, bottle of wine still raised halfway to my lips.
^Rummaging in her coat pocket, she pulls out a pack of cigarettes and lights one casually, clamping it somehow between her teeth.
^"And my name's Winter. So now we're uneven. You gotta tell me about yourself now."

c-1: ^She laughs and drops the cigarette, managing to catch it just before it hits the ground.
^"See, you *do* have a sense of humour."
^"So go on, then. Drink and talk."
g-0: ^I take another swig of the bad wine whilst I try to process what she said to me.
^I feel like she's told me some secret, sticky part of herself,
^but like she's told me nothing at all, too.
^"The girl in the party was... not really an ex."
g-1: ^I black out as the shadow talks through me, giving its own monologue.
^When I snap back, Red is finishing her cigarette, and I mumble the last few words.
^And now she's happily dancing with some guy and I'm,

c-4: ^I take another swig of the wine.
c-5: ^I can feel my chest get tight.
^I really don't want Winter to see me cry but I don't think I have a choice unless I just run away now.

g-2: ^I hand her the bottle and bring my knees up to my chest, heels resting on the edge of the bench.
^"So where does the shadow come in?"
^, but Winter's constant pushiness isn't leaving time.
^I'm angry that she keeps asking, and spiteful enough to tell her.
^I wonder if she'll call me a █████ too.
^"What is it that you're afraid of, Red?"
g-3: ^"I'm scared of what I wanted to do to her... still want to do."
^"And not just her, but others. Girls I knew before or who I see maybe once, and just... think about idly."
^"Girls aren't meant to have these thoughts, are we? Especially when we're trans."
^"We're meant to leave that behind. Just be nice and, like, receptive. Inoffensive and unproblematic."
^"But I think about how I want to touch or hurt or fuck her and I'm just..."
^"...I can't do it. I can't do it, but I want to."
^"I feel like I'm trespassing, unwanted and imposing, but *I can't stop wanting to.*"
^"And what used to be just some awful black part of my heart has just grown and grown until it was always *there*, looking over my shoulder."
^"I'm scared. I'm scared of the part of me that follows."
^I rest my head on my knees and try to keep myself very, very still.
g-4: ^The urge inside is to either stop moving forever, or else to flail and throw myself into the duck pond.
^Before I can commit to running away, Winter takes a deep breath and nods.
^I look over my knees at Winter's expression.
g-5: ^"I mean, we're almost exact opposites, you and I."
^"You're scared of being attracted to someone, and everything that entails."
^"And I'm... it's *being attractive to people* I can't stand."
^"I don't know how to make myself feel vulnerable, or to tolerate someone's eyes on me."
^"What's that phrase... the mortifying ordeal of being known?"
^"I want to, but there's armour I can't take off. Baggage that I can't put down."
^I look at her as she talks, her body language shrinking and the casual arrogance from earlier falling off like melting snow.
^She cradles the wine in her hands, bottle nearly empty, and laughs.
^"You know what we have to do, Red?"
g-6: ^"We're complimentary. You have a hangup about attraction to people, and I-- I don't."
^"And you... can show me what it looks like to be comfortable in your own skin, comfortable being looked at."
^I uncurl my legs and look at her, processing what she says.

s: ^"You're-- you're not suggesting we date after talking for fifteen minutes."

g-7: ^"I have someone I like already, and..."
^"I want to be attractive for him."
^"And you have someone you like, right? The girl from earlier?"
^As if that was ever a relationship that could happen again.
^Could or *should* happen again. I've burned that bridge and I've known that for a long time.
^I want to reconcile this part of myself.
^Something about Winter's intensity makes me trust her. Makes me want to trust her.
g-8: ^Winter leans down to put the bottle of wine on the ground, out the way.
^No. She reaches out to my shadow.
^I can almost feel when her fingers touch my other self's cheek.
^Like a memory of being touched, or a whisper of a breeze.

c-19: ^She grins tipsily and leans in to kiss me - to kiss the other me.
^It feels strange to watch her do so, white bone against black shadow.
^I can feel something warm on my lips, but it's barely there.
^I just stare at her for a second, so close to me, feeling something twist in my stomach.
^Then she draws back and wipes her mouth briefly with the back of her hand.
^Blood? No, lipstick. Lipstick smeared across teeth.
c-20: ^She draws back, letting her fingers run down my shadow's neck before they stop.
^My own shoulder feels electric, and I twitch away from it.
^"I won't kiss you, then. For now."
^"If we're doing this, I'll get to kiss you some time."
^I look at her, stare right into the depths of her eyes. Dark and hollow and sparkling.
c-21: ^A thought flashes through my mind, of climbing on top of her and pinning her to the bench.

s: ^I know I'm not meant to feel these things, and--

g-9: ^And then the shadow takes over again, and I black out.

g-0: ^"What do you mean, you don't cook?"
^Winter shrugs and pours herself another glass of wine, cigarette between her teeth.
^"I just don't. If I eat proper food I buy it."
^I look at her dumbfounded. She must be spending as much on takeout as I do on rent.

s: ^"How the hell do you afford it?"

c-1: ^"We aren't all broke PhD students, Red. I'm not *that* much of a stereotype."
^"I only spend a day a week on studies. The rest is programming."
^"You should take it up, honestly. Pays great."

c-0: ^"Sure. Flexible hours, work from home... it's a good gig."
^"I could teach you the basics sometime, if you want."
c-1: ^"We both are. That's the joke. Girls like us, we're broke or we're programmers. Or both."
^"Or baristas, I guess. When I first came out, I tried to make it work at Starbucks, because they cover all the big surgeries, but--"

c-2: ^She stares at me for a moment. Frowning, maybe?
c-3: ^She grins, and leans against the counter.

g-1: ^"Or... hmm. Maybe that's getting too personal."
^She slowly waves a finger at me to tell me off.
^"Besides, you didn't come here to criticise my cooking, did you?"

c-5: ^She shakes her head in mock disapproval.

g-2: ^"Tell me what we're doing this time."
^She takes a seat in the depths of her sofa, and sips her wine, watching me.
g-3: ^I tell her about the girl in my lecture who's sat next to me twice now, and asked me out for coffee once.

s: ^"And what do you want to do with her?"

g-4: ^As I talk, we start our little dance again.
^I can't remember how many times it's been now - six, seven maybe.
^The memories of each visit are so hard to pin down, just wisps of half-remembered touch.
^Winter lets me talk. And as I do, she performs whatever I say on my shadow, the fuzzy half-feeling of it rippling through me, as if muffled through cloth.
^She never seems self-conscious as I tell her things to do, never questions them.
^But I never let myself look at her for too long.
^It still looks like me in silhouette, but it's like there's another person layered over.

s: ^I have the horrible feeling it's Lilly.

g-5: ^Part of me feels guilt for this play-act we perform,
^all mixed up with the guilt I feel for having any feelings in the first place.
^I thought maybe it would start to go away, after we did this a few times, but it's barely made a dent.
^Instead it just feels I've made Winter culpable for my desires, too.
g-6: ^Winter senses something is wrong, and turns her attention from my shadow to me.
^For a moment it's difficult to talk with her fingers in my mouth,
^but then the fog clears, and I remember she's still only touching my shadow.

c-12: ^As I say no, I become increasingly sure I mean yes.

g-7: ^Winter draws back, kneeling in front of me on the bed.
^Kayfabe has been broken now, and I see the three of us as if from above.
^My shadow and Winter backing away from each other, like guilty teens caught in a cupboard,
^and myself watching the two of them from barely a foot away.
^The clothes Winter picked out for me barely register, until I realise I'm cold.
^I've been cold for some time, and never noticed.
^"You don't seem as into it today."
g-8: ^ I don't know about all this."
^She looks at me for a moment, then starts hunting around for her hoodie.
^I honestly can't answer. It's difficult to even know what I think.
^I curl my knees up to my chest and sit like that for a minute on the bed.
^The underwear Winter gave me to wear digs in at the sides, making it harder to breathe.

s: ^"Do you really feel like it's helping you at all?"

g-9: ^She turns to look back at me, unsure for a moment.
^"Am I getting anything out of this?"
^"Does watching you be comfortable with feeling attractive help *me*?"
^I don't feel comfortable. I don't feel anything about it either way. But I don't say it.
^Winter's eyes are hollow as she looks at me. They don't burn.
^"Knowing someone else can do what I can't... isn't having the revelatory effect I thought it might."
^I laugh into my knees and let myself unfurl again, lying down and looking at the ceiling.
g-10: ^"When I watch you fuck my shadow, it feels like there's some... quality, that you have and I don't."
^"Like someone gave you permission to feel these things. And that makes it alright."
^I hear her take a sip of water and sigh.

c-20: ^"But... it's not just permission to feel good, or take what you want, or impose."
c-21: ^She laughs then, and I prop myself up on my elbows to watch her do so.
^"You know that's not what I meant."

g-11: ^"It's more like... one partner gives permission to the other. So they can feel vulnerable."

s: ^"What if they don't do the same?"

c-22: ^"That's not the same as *being vulnerable. It's not the same as feeling safe* being vulnerable."
^"And if you don't get to feel that, if you don't *both* get that..."

g-12: ^"One person baring their soft little heart and the other stepping on it like a snail on wet pavement."
^I pull a face. And she grins back. She can't help it.
^I can hear the clock ticking as we sit on her bed in silence.
^"You have to face your fears, don't you?"

c-25: ^She trails off for a moment, lost for what to say.
c-26: ^"Was there any point in this otherwise?"

g-13: ^She stands up and turns to face me.
g-14: ^She shrugs. It doesn't come across as nonchalant, so much as evasive.
^"That's what this has all been for, right?"
^"You let me see how it feels to be comfortable in your own skin, and I put it into practice."
^"Is it the guy you mentioned before?"
^She nods, and holds my gaze defiantly, as if she's waiting for some criticism.
g-15: ^But just for a moment, I can feel it, as sharp as ice.
^I feel angry and bitter and broken that Winter has found more in our hookups than I have.
^That she's going to outpace me and leave me on my own. That this isn't a respite for me, it's not healing me, it's not helping, it's--
^I feel something cold wrap around my hands, as my shadow comes in closer to hug me, embrace me.

c-30: ^, and I realise just what I could do to her.

g-16: ^In a moment, a sentence or two, I could crush whatever tiny ember of confidence she's trying to keep alive.
^Tell her that everything she's begged me for will never work, as if she could really learn to be comfortable from me, learn to love herself from me,
^when I can't even keep all of myself together.
^But I know the urge is terrible, some monstrous thought that's gone as quickly as it came.
^I'm not angry at her, really. Just me.

g-0: ^My phone drags me out of a stupor as it rings.
^It's nearly midnight, and my tea has gone cold, forgotten as I drift off.
^God, I don't want to talk to her. Not tonight.

c-2: ^It gets to the sixth ring before I question what I'm doing.
^Winter almost never rings me. She hates talking on the phone.
^That, and the time, makes something feel very wrong.

g-1: ^The sound on the other end of the line is... crying.
^There's a pause, and she lets out a shaking breath.
g-2: ^Winter huddles at the end of my bed, her legs drawn up to her chest.
^I place a glass next to her and join her on the bed. Near, but not close.
^"Sorry it's... this. All I've got is cheap vodka."
^Winter necks it in one, and her shoulders hunch up as she makes a face.
^Then she stares down at the empty glass in her hands, and talks.
g-3: ^"I went to see the boy, finally. Like I said."
^"We had food and some drinks and he seemed... nice."
^"It felt really good to get that attention."
^"And I like him. Liked him. I don't know."
g-4: ^"We went back to my flat. And he-- we started to make out."
^"It felt so good at first to be desired. I felt... confident."
^"And he was so complimentary, I thought-- I thought it meant I was attractive."
^"I thought I could live with it, if that's how it felt."
g-5: ^"Like he was no longer seeing the person I'd been earlier, talking and flirting and being human, y'know?"
^"It felt like he was just looking at me and seeing a trans girl. An archtype-- no, that's too kind a word. A cut of meat that he liked."
^"And I wondered if he'd ever seen me as anything different."
g-6: ^"I thought maybe that I had to just endure it. That this is just how it feels, right?"
^"I hated it, more and more as it went on, but I couldn't tear myself away, in case I stopped just before it suddenly started to feel right."
^"But it never felt right, it never did, and when he finally finished, he couldn't even look at me."
^"He didn't look at me the same, even when he left. Like there was a distance, or... like it was an act."

c-12: ^ I reach out and touch her shoulder.
^Winter flinches a little, but doesn't push my hand away.
c-13: ^ The way someone fronts like they like you, like they want you, as a person. But they..."
c-14: ^ When I don't respond, Winter looks up at me.
^"Tell me I'm wrong about him, Red."

g-7: ^She sniffs and looks at my face for a moment.
^"I can still feel his hands on me."

s: ^"Like a drop of dye in water."

g-8: ^"Can you drown him out for me, Meredith?"

c-17: ^She looks down for a second, and somehow I can tell she's blushing.
^"I'm being sincere. Using your proper name felt right."

g-9: ^She pulls me towards her by the arm.
^Her grip is soft, and bitterly cold. But it's comforting, too. And when my hand reaches her skin...
^Have I ever actually touched her like this?
^I can feel my shadow stir next to me, remembering.
^"If I have to keep feeling someone's hands on me, I won't mind if it's you, Red."
^"I don't want to believe you see me the same way he did."
g-10: ^"I'll tell you what to do, what-- what he did."

s: ^"Just like the other times. Like did I for you."

g-11: ^My shadow guides my hand to her neck, and I don't fight it.
^Winter twitches as my fingertips brush her skin, willing herself to stay still.

c-21: ^Winter's hands join my own, working with mine to shrug off her blouse.
c-22: ^I grab her blouse, clumsily pulling it over her head. Her eyes are wide.
^Why can't I let myself want this?
c-23: ^Winter watches me for a moment, then takes her blouse off, and lets it fall down the side of the bed.

g-12: ^Out the corner of my eye I see her look at my face, watching me, waiting.
^"You're pretty. You've never shown me before."

c-24: ^I let my fingers drop to her stomach, tracing them along her side.
^Where I touch her, Winter instinctively moves away as if I've pushed.
^She makes a squashed little noise, and closes her eyes.
c-25: ^I let my hand cup her breast through the stretched fabric of her bra.
^It's plain, black, a recognisably standard and cautious choice.
^I think it's one she had me wear.
^Winter takes a breath, and I can feel her chest rise as she does so.
c-26: ^I look up at her, waiting for some kind of sign it's okay.

g-13: ^It feels strange to lead this dance.
^My shadow wraps itself around me, its hands on the back of my own. I can feel its heart beating through me.
^I think about how Winter did this before. To my shadow.
^I wonder if that's how she wants me to act, or...
g-14: ^"He had rough hands. They never stayed in one place long enough to get used to."

s: ^"Is there somewhere you want me to touch you?"

c-29: ^"When I asked him to touch somewhere, he'd get bored after a minute and move."

g-15: ^Without saying anything, she takes my hand between both of hers, and guides it to her neck.
^I run my thumb along the line where skin turns to bone.
^Her breath catches as my fingers trace up her jaw and come to rest on her cheekbone.
g-16: ^"Like a real person, soft to the touch."
^She raises her own hand to touch my face in return, her thin fingers mirroring mine on her cheek.
^Then she shifts her hand to my shadow instead, watching over my shoulder, and touches its cheek.
^I feel the fuzzy impression of it again, like static.
g-17: ^"Do you think it's really part of us?"
^"Or is your shadow and my face just some kind of delusion?"
^Winter tugs the shadow by the collar, and I fall forward with it, pinning her to the bed.
^She takes my hand and hesitantly guides it back to her neck.

c-35: ^, and she covers her eyes with the back of a hand.

g-18: ^"I never know if people can't see my skull or if they just don't care."
^"Would it be so bad? If they couldn't?"
^She peeks through her fingers at me.
^"I'm scared of someone being attracted to just part of me. To *that* part of me."
^"Like I might ruin myself by revealing that I'm human, too,
^and it's too much to bear for both of us."

c-36: ^"I wish it was so easy as believing you."
c-37: ^I don't know how to answer for a moment.
^"It feels weird to want you, for something that causes you pain."
c-38: ^"But that's-- that's okay. You can be that."
^"Can't believe you use my words against me."
^"I can force it if you want."

g-19: ^She moves her hand away and I meet her gaze.
g-20: ^a bird losing its feathers as it tumbles through the sky.
^Winter wants the dark part of me, and I want hers.
^"If it's a delusion - my shadow and your skull..."
^"Then it's one that's real to both of us."
^She grasps my hand gently again, and guides it higher to her eye socket.

g-0: ^I can hear Winter's breathing next to me, and I realise I'm awake.
^I open my eyes, and the two of us are in my bed still.
^She's asleep, facing away from me, slightly curled up.
^I realise I can see her face.
g-1: ^I sit there quietly for a few minutes, watching her sleep.
^For the first time, I can't feel my shadow behind me, watching.
^It's as if I've carried a backpack for so long I forgot, and then finally took it off.
g-2: ^When I eventually get up, Winter doesn't stir.
^But as the kettle boils, I hear her.
^I call back, and return with two mugs of coffee.
^Winter is sitting, rubbing her eyesockets, her skull once again staring back at me.
g-3: ^Where her blouse has fallen open, I can see the bruises on her neck, and my stomach twists a little, satisfaction against guilt.
^When I pass her the mug of coffee, my shadow is right back again, cradling my arm like a splint.
^But it doesn't feel as heavy anymore.
